5.knowledge: Pushing or pulling on an object can change the speed or direction of its motion and can start or stop it.

8.knowledge: When objects touch or collide, they push on one another and can change motion.

13.knowledge:
Pushing or pulling on an object can change the speed or direction of its motion and can start or stop it.
All organisms have external parts. Different animals use their body parts in different ways to see, hear, grasp objects, protect themselves, move from place to place, and seek, find, and take in food, water and air. Plants also have different parts (roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits) that help them survive and grow.

17.knowledge: When objects touch or collide, they push on one another and can change motion.
